name: floret
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
a small flower, especially one of the small flowers that is part of a larger flower: The ox-eye daisy or marguerite has yellow inner disc florets and spreading white outer florets. The lavender blossom is cone-shaped and composed of countless florets.
a small part of a vegetable that is shaped like a flower: broccoli/cauliflower florets You can cook broccoli very quickly by chopping the florets up into tiny pieces and grating the stems.
RosemaryCalvert/Photographer'sChoice/GettyImages
More examplesFewer examplesHydrangea florets can be picked and pressed in the autumn, when they are a lovely shade of green tinged with red.The plant has heads of cream flowers edged by extra lacy florets.If you are using broccoli, put the stems in before you put in the florets because they need more cooking. Serve with brown rice or jacket potato and cauliflower florets.Cut the cauliflower into florets and steam them for 3-5 minutes.
